meanings.definition: A container used to remove moisture from substances.
meanings.sent1: The desiccator helped dry out the wet chemicals in the lab.
meanings.sent2: The scientist placed the plant specimen in the desiccator to preserve it.
meanings.sent3: The desiccator sat quietly on the shelf, waiting for its next task.
meanings.sent4: Her heart felt like a desiccator, devoid of any emotion.
meanings.sent5: The desiccator hummed softly as it absorbed the moisture from the air.

meanings.definition: A person or thing that desiccates.
meanings.sent1: The sun was the ultimate desiccator, drying up the land.
meanings.sent2: The desiccator of dreams, he crushed every hope with his harsh words.
meanings.sent3: The old book was a desiccator of boredom, livening up the room with its exciting tales.
meanings.sent4: Time was a desiccator, slowly draining the vitality from the once vibrant city.
meanings.sent5: Her sharp words acted as a desiccator, sucking the enthusiasm out of the room.
